gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class CompositeContourControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.CompositeContourControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class CompositeContourControl
extends ViewControl

This ViewControl was designed specifically for the ContourViewComponent. It ha a control for specifying the data used to calculate uniformly spaced contor levels to draw, and a control used to specify manually entered contour levels to draw. The controls are placed in a tabbed pane.

See Also:
Serialized Form

public static final java.lang.String CONTOURS_CHANGED
See Also:
Constant Field Values

UNIFORM_CONTROL_STATE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String UNIFORM_CONTROL_STATE_KEY
"Uniform contour state" - This static constant String is used to reference the state information for the controls used to enter the uniformly entered contour levels. The value that this key references is an ObjectState of a FieldEntryControl.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NONUNIFORM_CONTROL_STATE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String NONUNIFORM_CONTROL_STATE_KEY
"Nonuniform contour state" - This static constant String is used to reference the state information for the controls used to enter the non uniformly entered contour levels. The value that this key refeences is an ObjectState of a ControlList.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REDRAW_BUTON_STATE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String REDRAW_BUTON_STATE_KEY
"Redraw button state" - This static constant String is used to reference the state information for the button used to redraw the contour plot using both the uinform and manually entered contour levels. The value that this key references is an ObjectState of a ButtonControl object.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final float DEFAULT_LOWEST_CONTOUR

Constructor Detail

CompositeContourControl

public CompositeContourControl(java.lang.String con_title,
                               ContourJPanel panel,
                               float minValue,
                               float maxValue,
                               int numLevels,
                               float[] levels,
                               boolean useManualLevels)
Constructs this control with the specifid title such that the given ContourJPanel is used to draw the contour plot. The values of the controls are initialized with the values given.

Parameters:
con_title - This control's title.
panel - The panel used to draw the contour plot.
minValue - Used in the controls used to specify the uniform contours. This is the value of the lowest contour level.
maxValue - Used in the controls used to specify the uniform contours. This is the value of the highest contour level.
numLevels - Used in the controls used to specify the uniform contours. This specifies the number of contour levels to draw.
levels - Used in the controls used to specify the manually entered contour levels. This specifies the manual contour levels to display.
useManualLevels - If true, the controls used to specify the manual contours is given focus. If false, the controls used to specify the uniformly spaced contour levels is given focus.

CompositeContourControl

public CompositeContourControl(ContourJPanel panel,
                               float minValue,
                               float maxValue,
                               int numLevels,
                               float[] levels,
                               boolean useManualLevels)
Constructs this control with a blank title such that the given ContourJPanel is used to draw the contour plot. The values of the controls are initialized with the values given.

Parameters:
panel - The panel used to draw the contour plot.
minValue - Used in the controls used to specify the uniform contours. This is the value of the lowest contour level.
maxValue - Used in the controls used to specify the uniform contours. This is the value of the highest contour level.
numLevels - Used in the controls used to specify the uniform contours. This specifies the number of contour levels to draw.
levels - Used in the controls used to specify the manually entered contour levels. This specifies the manual contour levels to display.
useManualLevels - If true, the controls used to specify the manual contours is given focus. If false, the controls used to specify the uniformly spaced contour levels is given focus.
Method Detail

setControlValue

public void setControlValue(java.lang.Object value)
Used to set the values displayed in one of the subcontrols on this control.

Specified by:
setControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
setControlValue in class ViewControl
Parameters:
value - A Contours object.
  • If this value is a UniformContours object, the values displayed in the control that is used to specify the uniform contour levels will be changed.
    • If this value is a NonUniformContours object, the values displayed in the control that is used to specify the nonuniform contour levels will be changed.
  • If the value is not of either of these types or if it is null, nothing is done.

getControlValue

public java.lang.Object getControlValue()
Used to get the values listed in the controls that are currently visible.

Specified by:
getControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
getControlValue in class ViewControl
Returns:
The values listed in the controls that have focus. If none of the controls are currently visible, or if the data entered in one of the controls is invalid null is returned. Otherwise, a UniformContours or NonUniformContours object is returned to encapsulate the data entered in the controls for the uniform or nonuniform contour levels respectively.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get the state of this control. This ViewControl is composed of three sub ViewControls (a control for entering the uniform contour levels, a control for entering the nonuniform contour levels, and a control for the button used to redraw the contour plot). The ObjectStates for all three of these controls are encapsulated in the ObjectState returned from this method.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
getObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
isDefault - If true the default state for this control is returned. Otherwise, the current state is returned.
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

setObjectState

public void setObjectState(ObjectState state)
Used to set the state of this ViewControl. This ViewControl is composed of three sub ViewControls (a control for entering the uniform contour levels, a control for entering the nonuniform contour levels, and a control for the button used to redraw the contour plot). The ObjectState given to this method should contain the ObjectStates of each of these sub ViewControls.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
setObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
state - The state of this ViewControl.

copy

public ViewControl copy()
Used to get an exact copy of this ViewControl.

Specified by:
copy in class ViewControl
Returns:
A deep copy of this ViewControl.
